publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3885 Stuart McMillan: Inverclyde Council Gold Healthy Working Lives Award Winner—That the Parliament congratulates Inverclyde Council for winning the Gold Healthy Working Lives Award in recognition of the council’s efforts to improve the health and wellbeing of its 4,800 staff; notes that Inverclyde Council’s workers benefited from health and lifestyle checks that included advice on maintaining healthy weight, blood pressure and cholesterol and that the checks were also made available to friends and family of staff, and further notes that the Scottish Centre for Healthy Working Lives was established in April 2005 and that it plays a key role in helping to reduce work-related ill health by 20% and days lost to ill health by 30%. Supported by: Kenneth Gibson*, Sandra White*, Aileen Campbell*, Rob Gibson*, Anne McLaughlin*, Alasdair Allan*, Christine Grahame*, Elaine Smith*, Bob Doris*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3885 Inverclyde Council Gold Healthy Working Lives Award Winner (lodged on 7 April 2009) Gil Paterson*
